events.message: The customer reported a rear-end collision that occurred on the highway during rush hour, causing damage to the rear bumper and trunk area.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial incident report and customer statements.
An agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to handle the case and will initiate further processing.
The customer was formally acknowledged about the claim receipt and informed of the next steps in the investigation process.
The customer was asked to provide photos of the vehicle damage, a police report, and repair estimates.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including police report and images showing the extent of damages.
The claims investigation team began reviewing submitted materials and contacting witnesses related to the collision.
Investigation confirmed the liability of the other party; damage estimations were validated by the adjuster.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer, covering vehicle repair costs and rental car reimbursement.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciation for the timely handling of their case.
Claim was formally approved based on the investigation results and customer's acceptance of the settlement offer.
Settlement payments were processed and transferred directly to the customer's account for prompt vehicle repairs.
The claim was closed after confirmation from the customer that the repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All documentation and records related to the claim have been archived for future reference and audit compliance.
